metadata.Title: CVE-2022-40617 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
strongSwan before 5.9.8 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service in the revocation plugin by sending a crafted end-entity (and intermediate CA) certificate that contains a CRL/OCSP URL that points to a server (under the attacker's control) that doesn't properly respond but (for example) just does nothing after the initial TCP handshake, or sends an excessive amount of application data.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-40617` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

charon-cmd - 5.8.2-1ubuntu3.5
charon-systemd - 5.8.2-1ubuntu3.5
libcharon-extauth-plugins - 5.8.2-1ubuntu3.5
libcharon-extra-plugins - 5.8.2-1ubuntu3.5
libcharon-standard-plugins - 5.8.2-1ubuntu3.5
libstrongswan - 5.8.2-1ubuntu3.5
libstrongswan-extra-plugins - 5.8.2-1ubuntu3.5
libstrongswan-standard-plugins - 5.8.2-1ubuntu3.5
strongswan - 5.8.2-1ubuntu3.5
strongswan-charon - 5.8.2-1ubuntu3.5
strongswan-libcharon - 5.8.2-1ubuntu3.5
strongswan-nm - 5.8.2-1ubuntu3.5
strongswan-pki - 5.8.2-1ubuntu3.5
strongswan-scepclient - 5.8.2-1ubuntu3.5
strongswan-starter - 5.8.2-1ubuntu3.5
strongswan-swanctl - 5.8.2-1ubuntu3.5
strongswan-tnc-base - 5.8.2-1ubuntu3.5
strongswan-tnc-client - 5.8.2-1ubuntu3.5
strongswan-tnc-ifmap - 5.8.2-1ubuntu3.5
strongswan-tnc-pdp - 5.8.2-1ubuntu3.5
strongswan-tnc-server - 5.8.2-1ubuntu3.5
No subscription required

criterions.comment: strongswan package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.8.2-1ubuntu3.5').
